content: this with this type of granny square we won t be chaining 1 between each cluster round 4 attach fourth colour in any space from the previous round chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet 2dc in the same space *in the next space work all of the following 3tr chain 2 3tr corner 3dc in next space 3hdc in next space 3dc in next space * repeat from ** 3 more times to get our 4 sides of our square you want your last stitches to be 3hdc sl st into top chain 3 of your first double_crochet don t fasten_off from here you can finish and continue making many more squares into whatever you desire be it a blanket cushion cover etc… the list in endless but if you wish to carry on with the bag continue on below      now we will be working in a traditional granny square using double_crochet rounds 5 6 chain 3 make 2 more double_crochet in the same space ch1 *3 double_crochet in next space chain 1 and so on until you reach a corner you then want to 3 double_crochet - chain 2 - 3 double_crochet - chain 1* the chain 2 creates the corner repeat from * all the way around until you come back to your very first chain 3 slip_stitch into the top of the third st continue on to round 6 once you have completed round 6 slip_stitch & fasten_off weave in your ends i finished here at round 6 but you can keep on going to make it as big as you want just repeat the same steps from rounds 5-6 *now repeat the same again for the second square *  once you have two squares we want to join 3 sides together leaving an opening at the top you can use whatever method of joining you prefer if you are unsure there are lots of youtube videos showing you different ways but here s how i do mine i put the right sides facing together the wrong sides being on the outside attach the fourth colour into a corner & chain 1 i then single_crochet into each st along the sides when i reach a corner i just put 1sc in said corner i then continue the same along the second side and the third side i slip_stitch into the last st don t fasten_off you ll have a ridge but don t worry you then want to flip your work inside out so that the right sides are on the outside now for the strap… from where you finished your slip_stitch you now want to chain as many as you want i chained around 150 i honestly lost count i just continued until i felt i was happy with the length it is a really nice length and reaches just past my hips i m 5 1 once you ve done the length of chain that you are happy with
